009package imagingbook.common.filter.examples;
010
011import imagingbook.common.filter.generic.GenericFilterVector;
012import imagingbook.common.image.PixelPack;
013
014// a custom filter that provides its own progress data
015public class FilterShowProgressExample extends GenericFilterVector {
016
017        // variables for progress reporting
018        private int maxCnt = 5000;
019        private int cnt;
020        
021        @Override
022        protected void initFilter(PixelPack source, PixelPack target) { 
023        }
024        
025        @Override
026        protected void initPass(PixelPack source, PixelPack target) {
027        }
028        
029        @Override
030        protected int passesRequired() {
031                return 3;       // needs 3 passes
032        }
033        
034        @Override
035        protected float[] doPixel(PixelPack source, int u, int v) {
036                float[] dummy = new float[3];
037                float sum = 0;
038                cnt = 0;
039                for (int i = 0; i < maxCnt; i++) {
040                        this.cnt = i;
041                        sum += (float) Math.sqrt(i); // some dummy work
042                }
043                cnt = 0;
044                dummy[0] = sum;
045                return dummy;
046        }
047        
048        // -------------------------------------------------------------
049        
050        @Override
051        protected double reportProgress() {
052                return (double) this.cnt / this.maxCnt;
053        }
054        
055//      public static void main(String[] args) {
056//              GenericFilter filter = new FilterShowProgressExample();
057//              ProgressMonitor mon = new ProgressMonitor(filter, 500);
058//              mon.start();
059//              PixelPack pp = new PixelPack(400, 300, 3, null);
060//              filter.applyTo(pp);
061//              mon.terminate();
062//      }
063
064}
